    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. The cube's triangles and normals are facing out and the same texture will be applied to each side of the cube.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. The cube's triangles and normals are facing either in or out and the same texture will be applied to each side of the cube.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut,
                          java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> futureTexture)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. The cube's triangles and normals are facing either in or out and the same texture will be applied to each side of the cube. All six faces share the same texture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.
        futureTexture - the texture for six faces. Future<GVRTexture> is used here for asynchronously loading the texture.

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut,
                          GVRMaterial material)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. The cube's triangles and normals are facing either in or out and the material is applied to the cube. To use the same texture on the six faces, use a material with the shader type GVRMaterial.GVRShaderType.Texture and a GVRTexture. To use different textures on different faces, use a material with the shader type GVRMaterial.GVRShaderType.Cubemap, and a cubemap texture loaded by GVRContext.loadFutureCubemapTexture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.
        material - the material for six faces.

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut,
                          GVRMaterial material,
                          org.joml.Vector3f dimensions)
        Constructs a box scene object with given dimensions. The triangles and normals are facing either in or out and the material is applied to the cube. To use the same texture on the six faces, use a material with the shader type GVRMaterial.GVRShaderType.Texture and a GVRTexture. To use different textures on different faces, use a material with the shader type GVRMaterial.GVRShaderType.Cubemap, and a cubemap texture loaded by GVRContext.loadFutureCubemapTexture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.
        material - the material for six faces.
        dimensions - Vector3f containing X, Y, Z dimensions

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture>> futureTextureList)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. The cube's triangles and normals are facing either in or out. Each face has its own texture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.
        futureTextureList - the list of six textures for six faces. Future<GVRTexture> is used here for asynchronously loading the texture. The six textures are for front, right, back, left, top, and bottom faces respectively.

      • GVRCubeSceneObject

        public GVRCubeSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                          boolean facingOut,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture>> futureTextureList,
                          int segmentNumber)
        Constructs a cube scene object with each side of length 1. Each face is subdivided into NxN quads, where N = segmentNumber is given by user. The cube's triangles and normals are facing either in or out. Each face has its own texture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        facingOut - whether the triangles and normals should be facing in or facing out.
        futureTextureList - the list of six textures for six faces. Future<GVRTexture> is used here for asynchronously loading the texture. The six textures are for front, right, back, left, top, and bottom faces respectively.
        segmentNumber - the segment number along each axis.
